subject: Colleges and Universities
Blacks
College Athletics
Coaches and Managers
organizations: Institute for Diversity and Ethics in Sport
lead_paragraph: With the recent dismissals of Ty Willingham at Washington and Ron Prince at Kansas State, the number of African-American head coaches in the 119-school N.C.A.A. Football Bowl Subdivision was reduced to four, the lowest in 15 years, according to a study. In 1997, there were eight black head coaches, the most in history. In 1993, there were three. Fifty-five percent of all student athletes are minorities. The report by the Institute for Diversity and Ethics in Sport at the University of Central Florida polled every major college on the ethnicity of its coaches, athletic directors, presidents, faculty, student athletes and N.C.A.A. faculty representatives.
